brooklyn.entity.group
[Java] Interface DynamicCluster

brooklyn.entity.Entity

                          brooklyn.entity.basic.AbstractGroup
                              brooklyn.entity.trait.Resizable
All Superinterfaces:
Entity, Identifiable, Changeable, Cluster, Startable, Group, AbstractGroup, Resizable
@ImplementedBy(DynamicClusterImpl.class)
public interface DynamicCluster
extends AbstractGroup, Cluster

A Cluster of entities that can dynamically increase or decrease the number of members.

When quarantine is enabled:

  • The cluster will have a child entity named quarantine, which is a Group for nodes that failed to start correctly.
  • The cluster's other children will be all nodes in the cluster (that have not been unmanaged/deleted).
  • The cluster's members will be all live nodes in the cluster.
  • The quarantine group's members will be any problem nodes (all nodes that failed to start correctly)
When quarantine is disabled, the cluster will not have a quarantine child. Nodes that fail to start will be removed from the cluster (i.e. stopped and deleted).

Advanced users will wish to examine the configuration for the NodePlacementStrategy and ZoneFailureDetector interfaces and their implementations, which are used here to control the placement of nodes in particular availability zones and locations when the cluster is resized.

See Also:
DynamicGroup
DynamicFabric
